beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Balkan Gravel? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Balkan Gravel scored 50 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Balkan Gravel. Slovenia/Croatia. 65 mi. Balkan mountainous gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Length. 3 out of 5. The Goldilocks zone of suffering. At 65 miles, this sits in the sweet spot for a day race rather than the region's multi-day epics. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Enough vertical to remind you gravity exists. 4500 feet across 65 miles delivers solid climbing without the sadistic ratios of longer Balkan events. Climate. 3 out of 5. Pack for two seasons. Historical weather data shows average highs of 67°F and lows of 49°F, with a 65% chance of rain on any given day. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. Experience. 3 out of 5. You'll remember this one. Mostly fondly. Tenul found locals "very friendly" and managed communication "quite well without English or German" with mountain farmers. Community. 3 out of 5. Genuine community feel. People stick around. The regional Balkan gravel scene draws 160 riders including elite talent like Tour Divide winner Justinas Leveika and Jenny Tough. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. Following regional pricing at €350, this delivers solid value for cross-border European gravel racing. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Altitude. 2 out of 5. Negligible altitude effect. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Building a name. Not there yet. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Modest field. Some fast riders in the mix. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Budget carefully. The extras get you.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Balkan Mountain Gravel. If you're in Balkans/Europe. yes, it's solid. If you're international. there are better options.
